Tax credits reduce the amount of tax you have to pay
Laghdaíonn creidmheasanna cánach an méid cánach a bhíonn ort a íoc
You can read about how your income tax is calculated for an explanation of how tax credits work
Is féidir leat léamh faoin gcaoi a ríomhtar do chuid cáin ioncam chun míniú a fháil ar conas mar a oibríonn creidmheasanna cánach
This document explains the tax credits that apply to the income of a deceased person
Míníonn an doiciméad seo na creidmheasanna cánach a bhaineann le h-ioncam dhuine atá básaithe
It also explains the tax credits and reliefs that are available to a widowed person or surviving civil partner
Míníonn sé chomh maith na creidmheasanna agus faoiseamh cánach atá ar fáil do bhaintreach/baintreach fir
You can get more information about other money matters after death
Is féidir leat eolas a fháil faoi chúrsaí airgeadais tar éis báis anseo
The year of death
Creidmheasanna cánach i rith na bliana báis

In the year in which they die, a single person has the normal tax credits to which they are entitled for the whole year, January to December. (Widowed people and surviving civil partners are treated in the same way.) If a refund of tax is due, it can be claimed by the person responsible for finalising the affairs of the deceased

Sa bhliain a fhaigheann siad bás, tá na gnáthchreidmheasanna cánach atá an duine singil i dteideal don bhliain iomlán, Eanáir go Nollaig.(Caitear le baintreach fir nó mná agus páirtnéirí shibhialta marthanaigh ar an gcaoi chéanna.) Má tá aisíoc cánach le n-íoc, is féidir leis an duine, atá freagrach as cúramaí airgeadais an té atá básaithe, éileamh a dhéanamh air
Unmarried couples are treated as single for tax purposes
Breathnaítear ar lánúineacha neamhphósta mar dhaoine singil ar mhaithe le cúrsaí cánach
If your spouse or civil partner dies, the way you are taxed in that year depends on how you were taxed as a couple
Má fháigheann do chéile bás, braitheann an chaoi a ngearrtar cáin ort an bhliain sin ar an gcaoi ar gearradh cáin oraibh mar lánúin
That is, whether you were taxed through Single Assessment, Separate Assessment or Joint Assessment
Sé sin, más rud é gur gearradh cáin ort trí mheasúnú singil, measúnú ar leith, nó comhmheasúnú
For more information on these options see the information on the taxation of married people and civil partners
Chun tuilleadh eolais a fháil ar na roghanna seo féach an t-eolas ar cháin ar dhaoine pósta
If you were both taxed as single persons then the Widowed Person's or Surviving Civil Partner's Tax Credit (see below) will replace the personal tax credit you had at the start of the year

Más rud é gur gearradh cáin ar an bheirt agaibh mar dhaoine singil mar sin tógfaidh creidmheasanna cánach an bhaintreach/baintreach fir (féach thíos) áit an creidmheasanna cánach phearsanta a bhí agat ag tús na bliana
If you and your spouse or civil partner were taxed under separate assessment then the Widowed Person's or Surviving Civil Partner's Tax Credit will replace your personal tax credit
Má gearradh cáin ortsa agus ar na chéile faoi mheasúnú ar leith th]ógfaidh an creidmheasanna cánach an bhaintreach/baintreach fir áit do chreidmheasanna cánach phearsanta
You may also be entitled to unused tax credits that were allocated to your spouse or civil partner
D'fhéadfadh tú a bheith i dteideal creidmheasanna cánach nar baineadh úsáid astu ach a bhí ag dul do do chéile
If a married couple is jointly assessed for tax, the spouse or civil partner with the obligation to make tax returns, etc., is known as the assessable spouse or nominated civil partner

Má dhéantar comhmheasúnú cánach ar lánúin phósta, glaoightear an céile inmheasúnaithe ar an céile a chaithfidh na foirmeach cánach a líonadh srl., agus glaoightear an céile neamh-inmheasúnaithe ar an céile eile
The assessable spouse or nominated civil partner is the person the couple has nominated as such
Sé an céile inmheasúnaithe an duine a roghnaíonn an lánúin féin

If no one has been nominated, the assessable person is the spouse or civil partner with the higher income and remains the assessable spouse or nominated civil partner until a decision is made to the contrary
Mura roghnaítear aon nduine, sé an céile leis an ioncam is airde an duine inmheasúnaithe agus fanann sé/sí mar an duine dhéantar measúnú air go dtí go ndéantar cinneadh eile
The tax treatment of a married couple jointly assessed to tax in the year where one spouse dies depends on whether the assessable spouse or the non-assessable spouse dies
Nuair a dhéantar Comhmheasúnú cánach ar lánúin phósta sa bhliain ina bhfaigheann duine acu bás, braitheann sé ar cé acu bhásaigh - an céile inmheasúnaithe nó an céile eile
Death of the non-assessable spouse
Bás céile nach ndéantar measúnú air/uirthi
In the tax year in which a non assessable spouse dies, the assessable spouse
Sa bhliain cánach ina bhfaigheann an céile nach ndéantar measúnú air/uirthi bás, gearrtar cáin ar an gcéile inmheasúnaithe
• Is taxable on his/her own total income for the full year plus the total income of his/her spouse to the date of death
• Ar a (h)ioncaim iomlán don bhliain iomlán chomh maith le ioncaim iomlán a c(h)éile go dtí dáta a b(h)ás
• Is entitled to the full amount of the married tax credit and the PAYE credit (2 PAYE credits if both have enough income taxable under the PAYE system)
• Tá sé/sí i dteideal an suim iomlán den chreidmheas cánach pósta agus an chreidmheas (2 chreidmheas ÍMAT má tá ioncaim cánach na beirte sách mór faoin gcóras ÍMAT)
• May claim other tax credits due to both spouses in that year
• D'fhéadfaí creidmheasanna cánach eile a éileamh ón bheirt agaibh sa bhliain sin
Death of the assessable spouse
Bás céile a dhéantar measúnú air/uirthi
For the period 1 January to the date of death, the assessable spouse:
Ón tréimhse 1 Eanair go dtí dáta an bháis, gearrtar cáin ioncaim iomlán na céile inmheasúnaithe:
• Is taxable on his/her own total income and the total income of his/her spouse for this period
• Agus gearrtar cáin air/uirthi ar ioncaim iomlán a c(h)éile don tréimhse sin
• Is entitled to the full amount of the married tax credit and the PAYE credit (2 PAYE credits if both have sufficient income taxable under the PAYE system)
• Tá sé/sí i dteideal an suim iomlán den chreidmheas cánach pósta agus an chreidmheas (2 chreidmheas ÍMAT má tá ioncaim cánach na beirte sách mór faoin gcóras ÍMAT)
• May claim a proportion of other credits up to date of death
• D'fhéadfaí cuid de chreidmheasanna eile a éileamh suas go dtí dáta an bháis
• Has the tax rate bands that apply to a married couple
• Tá rátaí bandaí cánach aige/aici a bhaineann le lánúin phósta
From the date of death to the end of the tax year, the widowed spouse:
Ó dháta an bháis go dtí deireadh na bliana cánachá an bhaintreach/baintreach fir:
• Is assessable on his/her own income for this period
• Inmheasúnaithe ar a (h)ioncaim don tréimhse seo
• Is entitled to the widowed person’s tax credit for year of bereavement and the PAYE credit (if taxed on PAYE)
• I dteideal creidmheas cánach baintrí don bhliain ina bhásaigh an duine agus creidmheas ÍMAT (má tá cáin á ghearradh ort ar ÍMAT)
• May claim tax credits for the period following the death
• D'fhéadfaí creidmheasanna cánach a éileamh don thréimhse taréis an bháis
• Has the tax rate bands that apply to a single/widowed person Following the year of death
• Tá an ráta banda cánach aige/aici a bhaineann le duine singil/baintreach
Widowed Person’s Tax Credit
Creidmheas cánach an bhaintreach/baintreach fir
An increased personal tax credit is available to widowed people
Tá méadú ar fáil duit ar do chreidmheas cánach phearsanta más baintreach thú
The amount of the tax credit varies according to whether or not the surviving spouse has dependent children and how recent the bereavement was
Braitheann méid an creidmheas cánach ar cé chomh luath agus a fuair an duine bás agus má tá páistí ag braith ar an céile a mhaireann
Widowed person without dependent children
Baintreach gan leanaí cleithiúnacha
A widowed person without a dependent child will still get the Married Person or Civil Partner's Tax Credit in the year of bereavement, which is €3,300 in 2016
Bíonn baintreach gan leanbh cleithiúnach i dteideal Creidmheas Cánach Dhuine Pósta a fháil le linn na bliana méala, rud is fiú €3,300 i 2016
Each year following the year of bereavement you will get the Widowed Person or Surviving Civil Partner's Tax Credit, which is €2,190 in 2016
Gheobhaidh tú Creidmheas Cánach Baintrí sna blianta ina dhiaidh sin, rud is fiú €2,190 i 2016
Widowed person with dependent children
Baintreach le leanaí cleithiúnacha
If you are a widowed person with a dependent child you will still get the Married Person or Civil Partner's Tax Credit in the year of bereavement which is €3,300 in 2016
Más baintreach tú agus má tá leanbh cleithiúnach ort gheobhaidh tú Creidmheas Cánach Dhuine Pósta le linn na bliana méala, rud is fiú €3,300 i 2016

In subsequent years, as long as you continue to have dependent children you will get a Widowed Person or Surviving Civil Partner's (with dependent children) Tax Credit (€1,650 in 2016) and a Single Person Child Carer Credit (€1,650 in 2016)

Gheobhaidh tú Creidmheas Cánach Baintrí (le leanaí cleithiúnacha) sna blianta ina dhiaidh sin fad atá leanaí cleithiúnacha agat. Is ionann é sin agus €1,650 i 2016. Lena chois sin gheobhaidh tú an Creidmheas Cánach Cúramóra Linbh do Dhuine Singil, rud is fiú €1,650 i 2016
You are also entitled to an additional tax credit, the Widowed Parent or Surviving Civil Partner Tax Credit, for the first five years after the year of death - see below
Bíonn tú i dteideal creidmheas cánach eile, Creidmheas Cánach Tuismitheora Baintrí, a bheith agat freisin ar feadh na chéad chúig bliana i ndiaidh an bháis - féach thíos
If you are widowed with dependent children and have not remarried but are cohabiting with a partner, you are not considered as a widowed person (with dependent children) for tax purposes

Má tharlaíonn sé gur baintreach tú agus leanaí cleithiúnacha ort, agus murar phós tú ach má tá tú i do chónaí le pháirtí, ní ghlactar leis chun críche cánach gur baintreach (le leanaí cleithiúnacha) tú
This means you are not entitled to the Widowed Person's (with dependent children) Tax Credit or the Single Person Child Carer Credit, however, you can get the Widowed Person's Tax Credit instead

Ciallaíonn sé seo nach bhfuil tú i dteideal Creidmheas Cánach Baintrí (le leanaí cleithiúnacha) a bheith agat nó Creidmheas Cánach Cúramóra Linbh do Dhuine Singil, ach féadfaidh tú Creidmheas Cánach Baintí a bheith agat ina n-áit, rud is fiú €2,190 i 2016
Also, if you are widowed and have not remarried but no longer have dependent children, you will not be considered as a widowed person (with dependent children)
Lena chois sin más baintreach tú agus murar phós tú arís, ach nach bhfuil leanaí cleithiúnacha agat a thuilleadh, ní ghlacfar leis gur baintreach (le leanaí cleithiúnacha) tú
Instead, you will get the Widowed Person or Surviving Civil Partner's Tax Credit
Mar mhalairt air sin gheobhaidh tú Creidmheas Cánach Baintrí
The Widowed Parent or Surviving Civil Partner Tax Credit is available for five years, beginning in the year after the year of bereavement
Tá sé ar fáil ar feadh cúig bliana, ag tosnútar éis na bliana a fhaigheann an duine bás
If you are bereaved in 2016 you will not get a Widowed Parent or Surviving Civil Partner Tax Credit untill 2017
Má tharlaíonn sé gur baintreach tú i 2016, ní gheobhaidh tú Creidmheas Cánach Tuismitheora Baintrí roimh 2017
Only one Widowed Parent Tax or Surviving Civil Partner Credit is granted, irrespective of the number of children
Ní thugtar ach Creidmheas Cánach Tuismitheora Baintrí amháin is cuma cé mhéid leanaí atá agat
The amount of the tax credit varies each year as follows:
Athraíonn méid an chreidmheas cánach gach bliain mar seo a leanas:

To qualify for the Widowed Parent or Surviving Civil Partner Tax Credit:
Chun cáiliú don Chreidmheas Cánach an Bhaintreach/Baintreach Fir:
• You must not have re-married by the start of the tax year and must not be cohabiting with a partner
• Caithfidh páiste incháilithe a bheith ina c(h)ónaí leat do chuid den bhliain cánach
• A qualifying child must reside with you for some part of the tax year
• Níl cead tugtha ach do chreidmheas cánach amháin, is cuma cé mhéad páiste atá i gceist
• The child must be under 18 or, if over 18, in full-time eduction or undergoing a full-time training course for a trade or profession for a minimum of 2 years
• Caithfidh an páiste a bheith faoi 18, má tá sé os cionn 18, in oideachas lán aimseartha
There is no age restriction if the child became permanently incapacitated when under 21 or in full-time education or training
Níl aon srian ó thaobh aois de má tharlaíonn míchumais lánaimseartha den pháiste agus sé/sí faoi 21 nó in oideachas/traenáil lán aimseartha
• The child may be an adopted child, a stepchild or any child that you support and have custody of
• D'fhéadfadh an páiste a bheith uchtaithe, a bheith ina leas-leanbh nó aon pháiste atá ag braith ort agus atá faoi do chúraim
Following the death of a spouse, you should contact Revenue to inform them so that they can arrange for you to receive the appropriate tax credits

Tar éis bháis do chéile, ba chóir duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim chun iad a chuir ar an eolas ionas go mbeadh siad in ann a dhéanamh cinnte go bhfaighidh tú na creidmheasanna cánach cuí
Please remember to have your PPS number to hand in any dealings with Revenue
Ná déan dearmad do uimhir PSP a bheith agat agus thú ag déileáil leis na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim
You can also claim tax credits online
Is féidir leat freisin creidmheasanna cánach a éileamh ar an idirlíon
You can claim tax credits online using Revenue's PAYE Anytime service which is accessed through Revenue's myAccount
Uimhreacha ló-ghlaoch teileafóin do oifigí réigiúnach na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim ar fáil anseo
Lo-call telephone numbers for Revenue regional offices are available here. You can find more detailed contact details for your region
Is féidir leat a thuilleadh leat a thuilleadh eolais a fháil faoi shonraí teagmhála do do réigiún anseo
